subclassFeature.name: Gunslinger
entries: Most rogues and specialists spend their years of expertise on learning a specific skill-set, whether that be assassination, thievery, or courtroom dialogue. However, what is arguably the most deadly is a rogue who has devoted themselves in their entirety to the act of researching weapons - exposive weapons.

This archetype focuses on key points that the Fighter variant does not. Namely, less focus on the crafting of unique firearms and more emphasis on the act of utilizing existing ones; exploiting weaknesses in your opponent has never been easier than with the Gunslinger Rogue.

subclassFeature.name: Firearm Proficiency
entries: Starting when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with firearms, allowing you to add your proficiency bonus to attacks made with firearms.

subclassFeature.name: Careful Aim
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, your Cunning Action improves. Aiming while wielding a firearm decreases that firearm's misfire value by 1 until the end of the turn. In addition, if your weapon misfires, you can use a reaction to prevent it from jamming using your finesse. You can only use your reaction this way once per short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Silencer
entries: Starting at 9th level, you have learned to modify your guns to elicit no sound upon firing. Whenever you make an attack while under the {@action Hide} action, you may choose to fire a suppresed shot from your firearm. If you do so, regardless of whether you hit or miss your target, you do not give away your location. Suppressed shots fired this way lower your Sneak Attack die by half (rounded down).
You cannot use this feature within 15 feet of your target, nor can you use it alongside a firearm with the Explosive or Scatter properties.

subclassFeature.name: Practiced Sniper
entries: Starting at 13th level, you add your proficiency bonus to your initiative. In addition, your firearm attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20, and making a critical strike with a firearm activates your Sneak Attack feature, regardless of whether you had advantage or not.

subclassFeature.name: Absolute Operator
entries: Starting at 17th level, your fast hands become an extraordinary asset while firing guns. Whenever you aim while wielding a firearm, you may reload one bullet into your gun.
